title: Ticket #1344: StartLog "can't find resource with ClaimId": Which command?
description:
The condor_startd will emit an error message of the form "can't find resource with ClaimId". There are several different code paths that emit the same error message (See src/condor_startd.V6/command.cpp and src/condor_startd.V6/util.cpp), so if you see this error in an error message, you're not sure which path it was, or what command was received. I'd debugging a problem where I'm seeing a spat of these error messages for different ClaimIds and I can't explain why. I'm going to ask the user to turn on D_COMMAND, but this adds another round trip by email and a delay while he waits for the problem to reoccur.

Improvement: log the command, ideally by name, but even number would be good, for all of these messages.
remarks:
2010-Apr-13 17:52:20 by tstclair:
If the logs are available that would likely be beneficial, b/c it usually contains crumbs as to the source of entry.

2010-Apr-16 14:15:26 by adesmet:
Implemented for 7.5.3.
check_ins: 2010-Apr-16 14:13   Check-in [17873]: When the startd ignores a command because it can't find the ClaimId, it logs a warning to the log. That message now includes the command number and name, simplifying debugging. #1344 (By Alan De Smet )
creator: adesmet
